verdict_rationale: 3 of 4 primary KPIs pass thresholds. Pain intensity 7.2/10 (pass), workarounds 30% (fail), recency 70% (pass), trend 5+ consecutive MoM increases (pass). Strong pain signals and growing trend indicate opportunity, but low workaround rate requires deeper validation through customer interviews.

kpis.name: Pain Intensity
kpis.evidence: Average 7.2/10 severity from 100 mentions across Reddit, TrustPilot, Facebook, and news sources. Top pain themes: delivery delays (32%), traffic/infrastructure (23%), missing items (18%), cost pressures (15%), time management (12%)

kpis.name: Active Workarounds
kpis.evidence: 30 of 100 mentions describe workarounds including ordering directly from restaurants, using traditional kiryana stores (90% of market), buying personal transport, checking traffic maps, and buying water tankers. Low rate suggests either opportunity (no good solutions exist) or risk (pain not action-worthy)

kpis.name: Problem Recency
kpis.evidence: 70 of 100 mentions occurred in last 90 days (Oct 17, 2024 - Jan 15, 2025). Monthly trend shows acceleration: Aug 2024 (6) → Sep (8) → Oct (10) → Nov (12) → Dec (15) → Jan 2025 (38 mentions)

kpis.name: Trend Growth
kpis.evidence: 5+ consecutive months of MoM increases (Aug → Sep → Oct → Nov → Dec 2024). Growing trend driven by infrastructure deterioration, existing player failures (Foodpanda 1.1/5, Daraz 1.3/5), new market entrants (Krave Mart, Yango-DealCart), and economic pressures
